data.title: Debra S Lindsay
data.meta_site_name: Pollock-Randall & Marysville Funeral Homes - Port Huron, MI
data.text:
Debra Sue (Boshaw) Lindsay, 58, of Port Huron, went on to be with the Lord on Thursday, February 9, 2017.

Debra was born October 22, 1958 to the union of the late Sherwood and Azalea Boshaw, in Port Huron, Michigan. She married Richard Lindsay on June 11, 1994, in Port Huron.

Mrs. Lindsay graduated from the Port Huron School District and went on to attend Baker College, where she finished at the top of her class. She had a passion for taking care of the elderly and worked as a medical assistant in nursing homes. She loved spending time with her family. Debra was a beautiful, strong and warmhearted woman, that always had a warm bubbly smile on her face and would give anyone the shirt off her back. She was also an active member of Faith Christian Community Church.

She leaves to cherish her memory, her devoted and loving husband, Richard Lindsay; her adoring children, Jimmy Boshaw-Conroy and Sean Boshaw-Conroy; two loving stepdaughters, Theresa (Charles) Rice and Brandi Lindsay; a warm step grandson, Terez Watkins; five fond brothers, Ronald Boshaw, Sam (Jean) Catanzaro, Dan (Teresa) Catanzaro, Joe Houle and Michael Houle; a loving sister, Vickie Humphrie; and a host of brothers-in-law, sisters-in-law, nieces, nephews and friends.

Funeral services will be held at 11 a.m. on Tuesday, February 14, 2017 in Faith Christian Community Church with visitation beginning at 10 a.m. Pastor Tray Smith will officiate.

Memorials may be made to the family. Arrangements are by Pollock-Randall Funeral Home.
